str2: A leprous person, a leper. From the same as lepra; scaly, i.e. Leprous.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular

str2: To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From a compound of gonu and the alternate of pipto; to fall on the knee.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.
